title: Vapor Liquid Equilibrium Data Schema
description: In the Vapor Liquid Equilibrium test, a mixture of oil and injection gas is equilibrated in a fixed condition of pressure and temperature where two distinct vapor and liquid phases are present. Properties of each phase (composition, density, viscosity) are also used to optimize an equation-of-state model to represent phase equilibria during gas injection EOR process.

SamplesAnalysisID.title: Samples Analysis D
SamplesAnalysisID.description: The OSDU Identifier for this SamplesAnalysis.

SampleID.title: Sample ID
SampleID.description: The OSDU Identifier for the Sample associated with this analysis.

Meta.title: Meta
Meta.description: A meta data item, which allows the association of named properties or property values to a Unit/Measurement/CRS/Azimuth/Time context.

items.title: Frame of Reference Meta Data Item
items.description: A meta data item, which allows the association of named properties or property values to a Unit/Measurement/CRS/Azimuth/Time context.

kind.title: UOM Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, 'Unit' for FrameOfReferenceUOM.

name.title: UOM Unit Symbol
name.description: The unit symbol or name of the unit.

persistableReference.title: UOM Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying the Unit.

unitOfMeasureID.description: SRN to unit of measure reference.

propertyNames.title: UOM Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides Unit context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: CRS Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'CRS' for FrameOfReferenceCRS.

persistableReference.title: CRS Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying the CRS.

propertyNames.title: CRS Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides CRS context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: DateTime Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'DateTime', for FrameOfReferenceDateTime.

name.title: DateTime Name
name.description: The name of the DateTime format and reference.

persistableReference.title: DateTime Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying DateTime reference.

propertyNames.title: DateTime Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides DateTime context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: AzimuthReference Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'AzimuthReference', for FrameOfReferenceAzimuthReference.

name.title: AzimuthReference Name
name.description: The name of the CRS or the symbol/name of the unit.

persistableReference.title: AzimuthReference Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying AzimuthReference.

propertyNames.title: AzimuthReference Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides AzimuthReference context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

TestNumber.title: Test Number
TestNumber.description: A unique identifier assigned to the specific VLE test for tracking and reference purposes.

TestTemperature.title: Test Temperature
TestTemperature.description: The recorded temperature within the test environment.

TestPressure.title: Test Pressure
TestPressure.description: The pressure at which the VLE test is conducted, influencing the equilibrium between vapor and liquid phases.

GasSolventAdded.title: Gas Solvent Added
GasSolventAdded.description: The type and amount of gas solvent introduced into the mixture to assess its effect on phase behavior.

MixtureVolume.title: Mixture Volume
MixtureVolume.description: The total volume of the gas-liquid mixture used in the VLE test, critical for understanding the proportions of phases.

MixtureGasSolventMoleFraction.title: Mixture Gas Solvent Mole Fraction
MixtureGasSolventMoleFraction.description: The mole fraction of the gas solvent in the mixture, which indicates its proportion relative to other components.

MixtureGOR.title: Mixture Gas Oil Ratio
MixtureGOR.description: The Gas-Oil Ratio (GOR) of the mixture, representing the amount of gas relative to liquid by volume at standard conditions.

MixturePsatTestTemperature.title: Mixture Psat Test Temperature
MixturePsatTestTemperature.description: The temperature at which the mixtureâ€™s saturation pressure is determined during the test.

MixtureRelativeVolumeRelativeToPsat.title: Mixture Relative Volume Relative To Psat
MixtureRelativeVolumeRelativeToPsat.description: The measured relative volume ratio = measured volume/volume at Psat.

AtmosphericFlashTestReference.title: Atmospheric Flash Test Reference
AtmosphericFlashTestReference.description: A reference to the atmospheric flash test, used to describe the behavior of the mixture when brought to atmospheric pressure.

InjectedGasAdded.title: Injected Gas Added
InjectedGasAdded.description: The quantity of gas injected into the system during the test, which affects phase compositions and behavior.

CumulativeGasAdded.title: Cumulative Gas Added
CumulativeGasAdded.description: The total amount of gas added over the course of the test, providing insight into gas saturation levels.

VaporPhaseVolume.title: Vapor Phase Volume
VaporPhaseVolume.description: The volume of the vapor phase at equilibrium, important for calculating phase proportions and gas properties.

VaporPhaseViscosity.title: Vapor Phase Viscosity
VaporPhaseViscosity.description: The viscosity of the vapor phase, describing its resistance to flow, which affects transport and mobility in the system.

VaporPhaseDensity.title: VaporPhase Density
VaporPhaseDensity.description: The density of the vapor phase, a critical property for calculating mass and transport characteristics.

LiquidPhaseVolume.title: Liquid Phase Volume
LiquidPhaseVolume.description: The volume of the liquid phase at equilibrium, used to determine the relative amounts of vapor and liquid phases.

LiquidPhaseDensity.title: Liquid Phase Density
LiquidPhaseDensity.description: The density of the liquid phase, important for understanding mass, flow properties, and phase behavior.

VaporComposition.title: Vapor Composition
VaporComposition.description: The overall composition of the vapor phase, detailing the proportion of each component present.

items.title: Vapor Composition
items.description: The overall composition of the vapor phase, detailing the proportion of each component present.

ComponentNameID.title: Component Name ID
ComponentNameID.description: The specific name of each component in the vapor phase, such as methane or ethane.

MoleFraction.title: Mole Fraction
MoleFraction.description: The mole fraction of each component in the vapor phase, indicating its relative abundance by mole.

MassFraction.title: Mass Fraction
MassFraction.description: The mass fraction of each component in the vapor phase, indicating its relative abundance by mass.

Remarks.title: Remarks
Remarks.description: Array object capturing remarks or additional information for this test step.  Remarks for the analysis as a whole should be captured in the associated SamplesAnalysis work product component.

items.title: AbstractRemark
items.description: A remark object, pairing a remark text with a source, e.g. an author, and a date, which is typically included in an array. The RemarkSequenceNumber acts as unique key in this case.

RemarkSequenceNumber.title: Remark Sequence Number
RemarkSequenceNumber.description: A unique identifier for each remark record. This identifier is used to uniquely identify a member in an array of remarks.

Remark.title: Remark
Remark.description: A descriptive comment for this remark.

RemarkSource.title: Remark Source
RemarkSource.description: The person, vendor, interpreter or other provider of information.

RemarkDate.title: Remark Date
RemarkDate.description: The date the remark was issued.

VaporTransportTestReference.title: Vapor Transport Test Reference
VaporTransportTestReference.description: A reference to a test assessing the transport properties of the vapor phase, such as flow rates or permeability.

LiquidTransportTestReference.title: Liquid Transport Test Reference
LiquidTransportTestReference.description: A reference to a test assessing the transport properties of the liquid phase, like viscosity or diffusion rates.

LiquidComposition.title: Liquid Composition
LiquidComposition.description: The overall composition of the liquid phase, detailing the proportion of each component present.

items.title: Liquid Composition
items.description: The overall composition of the liquid phase, detailing the proportion of each component present.

ComponentNameID.title: Component Name ID
ComponentNameID.description: The specific name of each component in the liquid phase, such as water or hydrocarbons.

MoleFraction.title: Mole Fraction
MoleFraction.description: The mole fraction of each component in the liquid phase, indicating its relative abundance by mole.

MassFraction.title: Mass Fraction
MassFraction.description: The mass fraction of each component in the liquid phase, indicating its relative abundance by mass.

Remarks.title: Remarks
Remarks.description: Array object capturing remarks or additional information for this test step.  Remarks for the analysis as a whole should be captured in the associated SamplesAnalysis work product component.
